page.title: 17BROWNDOWN ARMY CAMP,GOSPORT.
page.content: {Browndown Camp}lies between Gosport and Lee-on-the-Solent and dates back to before 1848.French prisoners built the first butts.The last fatal duel was fought there.Nowadays military people from 12 to 55 years old (cadets to regular service men) can book the camp for 3 to 15 days to do{field {craft,map reading,weapon training}and {water sports.}Military hospitals also practicse here.Each group caters for themselves and arranges their own activities.Using the huts and surroundings which is rough ground with shingle,heather and gorse predominating.There is a resident caretaker and the site is well booked. The ranges are now closed due to accidents.It is now a conservation area with rabbits,foxes and many insects and other wildlife.
